message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.FL. 

The paper deals with the verification of concurrent programs using Access Permissions (APs) as an abstraction for controlling concurrent executions. This involves representing APs as constraints and using processes to model their dependencies. These concepts are closely related to programming languages and verification, which are covered by the sub-categories cs.PL (Programming Languages), cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), and cs.SE (Software Engineering). Additionally, the paper discusses the complexity of proofs, which is related to the sub-category cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper presents a tool for animation and verification, which is related to the sub-category cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory).
